We didn‚Äôt panic as we still had my card and our travel card.
However, the card machine as the hotel didn‚Äôt work with either of these so the man on reception asked us to lift cash at an ATM or leave our passport with him which we did not want to do.

We told the hotel and they did not care that we now had absolutely no way of paying and just wanted our passports.
We called our parents who were willing to do international transfer over the phone which we were told no again by reception.
Our phone could still do contactless and we got told No again even though there was a contactless payment sign on the reception desk.
After a stressful few hours of contacting our banks back home - we got the travel card accepted at the hotel and were able to pay.

Overall great experience will definitely recommend and come back

If you‚Äôre not used to crazy traffic, it wears on you and wanting to walk more for good food might not be your jam - BYO shampoo, conditioner.
There was no conditioner provided and the shampoo bottles were not great - Night time showers for the brave - you either get hot with poor pressure or cold water with decent pressure.

- Overall it was a good stay for the amount we were paying for but it was quite off putting that we were constantly asked to leave a review.
I understand that the nature of the business requires this but the hotel would be served better if they only asked guests once, at check out or the night before.

- Upon providing what I thought was a fair number (8) and some constructive feedback - none of which were actually that negative (eg some conditioner would be nice and shampoo bottles that had better pump rates), we were met with at best, concern and at worst, defensiveness from the staff (eg when did this happen, did you tell anyone about it?).

Location & Staffs
This was my first time in Vietnam and I could not have had a better time.
The customer service is the best.
They went above and beyond from the moment I made the reservation.
They made great recommendations for day trips outside and in Ha Noi which made my life so much easier since I had to do way less research to know how to make the most out of my time in Vietnam.
The staff was always happy and efficient, whenever we entered or exited they would greet us and ask if we were in need of anything.
A member of our group was celebrating her birthday and they helped us organize a surprise for her with cake and flowers when we came back from our day trip.
She loved it and it definitely made this a birthday she will remember.
They were always helpful and no request was too small or too big.
The room looked just like in the pictures.
They had AC in the room which is a must in the hot days.
We also had no noise issues even though we were on the 2nd floor and the street is very active at night.
Having a good night sleep will not be an issue because of the double windows.
The location is amazing.
There are several restaurants nearby where you can experience the local cuisine with a great range of prices, from cheap to fancy.
You are also in walking distance to many of the must see locations in Ha Noi such as the Hoa Lo Prison, St.
Joseph‚Äôs Cathedral, Hoan Kiem Lake, the Train Street, the Night Market, and Hang Gai (Silk Street).
Even if you want to go somewhere a little bit far which might require a car ride, the staff will assist you getting a cab to and from the location and help you avoid any possible scammers.
If you like to take pictures, there are several places just outside that provide a great background, instagram worthy ;).I really enjoyed my stay and I know this is where I am staying next time!
There wasn‚Äôt anything I didn‚Äôt like.
They don‚Äôt have a restaurant in the hotel, but even this was not an issue because they are located in a great area with amazing restaurants.
It was actually good because it led to us trying more of the local cuisine than I usually would when traveling abroad.
Even if you have a weak stomach you will be ok because there are restaurants that serve western dishes, fast food joints such as Mc Donalds and supermarkets all in walking distance.

The pictures of your selected room online are misleading.

We booked this hotel based on photos that do not reflect the reality.

I have stayed in this hotel for 2 nights from 15/8 to 17/8/2024, and their level of service is beyond exceptional.
Cara and Ivy went above and beyond their way just to help me with some questions.
I have had a few incidents with 2 of my room.

One was the blockage of water didn't get out fast enough from the bathroom, which turned out to be a false alarm, my daughter mistaken that for the rain shower spraying out from the top, so it wasn't blocked at all.
And my room ac turned off by itself at 3am making it so hot, which my mistake, didn't see the on off button, could have just turned it back on instead but i called the front desk.

The next morning, everyone in the service desk from lobby to 3rd floor breakfast area knew about my incidents and they continuously apologize and making it up to ensure that they are so sorry about this experience.
Which is not their fault to begin with.
It is just a small issue.
But the fact that they are on top of things, really amaze me.
It doesn't end there, they went on to inform me that since i am going to leave for the airport at 1pm, they asked me to have a late check out in order to have a good rest before leaving for airport.
That was really good because the weather was too hot and a quick shower was really helpful.
Then they even informed me that they have prepared a car to drive me and my family to the airport which was way too nice of them to do that.
This is really a great experience and for them going out of their way to provide me and my family with such comfortable stay, it is absolutely lovely.
Rooms are spacious.
And it is clean everyday.
The bathroom is clean with full toiletries.
Breakfast is good enough and most importantly they can even book a grab for me when i ran out of my data and couldn't access my grab app.
This is really an amazing experience and part of the travel is knowing that you are well taken care of.
And i felt that in Fivitel.
Sound from the outside as i was on the 7th floor and I could hear the sound from the workers outside at night.
The windows is a bit loose on the latch.
But it didn't bother me at all, thank goodness.
Their level of service was above everything else, that is why i didn't even bother to inform them about this minor issue.

I recently had the pleasure of visiting Hanoi, Vietnam and staying at the Hanoi Traveler House.
From start to finish, my experience at this hotel was exceptional.
The hotel itself was very good, offering comfortable accommodations and a welcoming atmosphere.
What truly set this place apart, however, was the staff.
The entire team was incredibly cooperative, and the manager, in particular, was a shining example of hospitality.
She had a heart of gold and welcomed guests with warmth and positivity every single time we entered the hotel, no matter how frequent our visits.
Their slogan, "Your home away from home," couldn't be more accurate.
I genuinely felt like I was in a home away from home during my stay, with the entire staff making me feel like a part of their family.
This sense of belonging made my time in Hanoi all the more wonderful.
I wholeheartedly recommend the Hanoi Traveler House to anyone visiting Hanoi.
It's a place where you not only find excellent accommodations but also experience the warmth and hospitality that make a trip truly memorable.
It was a truly wonderful experience that I won't soon forget.

30 and left both dorm door and terrace door open while cleaning the terrace and sweeping the floors.

I‚Äôve stayed in many many hostels and hotels and never once in my life experienced this.

I understand this isn‚Äôt necessarily a fault of the hostel but some rules should have been enforced.
Maybe reminder about not being selfish prick could be a start.
One girl was watching things out loud on the highest volume which resulted in a guy in our dorm telling her off.

Not a bad hotel, but I can't say it's worth its money.
The hotel offers a standard set of amenities typical of five-star accommodation.
Three aspects deserve special attention:1.
The hotel grounds- Magnificent exterior of French villas- Cozy atmosphere with decorative lighting- Spacious park area2.
Location- Convenient location near the centre- Easy accessibility by cab- Walking distance3.

Staff- Exceptionally friendly and welcoming staff- Highly responsive to all requests- Comfortable interaction- Excellent level of serviceParticularly impressed with the professionalism of the staff in providing first-class service throughout the stay.
Areas for Improvement:While appreciating the hotel's positive aspects, there are several points that could be enhanced to fully justify the 5-star rating and price point.
The room furnishings, though attempting a classic style, show signs of wear and require updating.
Housekeeping attention to detail needs improvement, particularly regarding cleanliness standards.
The mattress comfort level falls short of luxury hotel expectations.
The understaffing issues affected the swimming pool maintenance, requiring guest intervention to ensure proper cleaning.
The property's security policy creates an inconvenience by restricting taxi access to villas while allowing local traffic through the grounds.
The breakfast service, while adequate, doesn't maintain consistent quality and variety throughout the serving period, particularly after 9 AM, with items not being replenished promptly.
While the hotel offers a pleasant stay, these aspects indicate a need for service refinement to match its premium positioning and price point.

In the room we could hear this very distinct sound of something electrical going on and off rhythmically during the night, i‚Äôve tried to explain it but no one seemed to care or understand (plus lot of stray dogs barking during the whole night).

The Vedana Lagoon is a fantastic resort and exceptional value for money.
We had a hill villa, which was huge and had its own pool.
The resort facilities are brilliant.
The two large swimming pools are lovely while the spa provides amazing massages.
Miss Hue (not sure that is the right spelling) was simply superb.
The prices in the spa are high, but the ambience and professionalism are worth it.
The breakfast is magnificent!
There is an amazing spread of western, Asian and fusion dishes.
All are cooked to perfection with fresh ingredients.
The dinner menu, like the spa, is expensive but the quality is very high and the portions are huge.
Finally, the staff are all exceptional.
Christy in customer services is excellent and every staff member we encountered was friendly, helpful and smiley!
In the interests of continual improvement, I offer the following observations.
They are very minor and should not be taken as criticism.
Firstly, I think the resort could do away completely with single use plastics and make more use of solar panels given the huge roof areas available.
Secondly, the staff do a good job of keeping the beach areas litter free but it is obviously a never ending battle.
A little more resource would help, but education and assistance to the local fishing villages (where the litter comes from) might help.
Finally, a couple of hotel vehicles had faulty seatbelts.
While the resort was quiet it was possible to change seats but I would prefer all seatbelts to be in full working order.

I recently had the pleasure of staying at Green Tea Villa in Hoi An, and it was a truly unforgettable experience.
The villa is nestled in a beautiful, peaceful setting, surrounded by lush gardens and nature, offering the perfect retreat from the city.
The rooms are impeccably designed, combining traditional Vietnamese charm with modern comforts, creating a serene and welcoming atmosphere.
What made the stay even more special was the incredibly kind and thoughtful staff.
They went out of their way to ensure every detail was perfect, always offering warm smiles and helpful tips on exploring the local area.

Green Tea Villa is the perfect Hoi An retreat.

Our room was huge and had a private terrace and a bathtub.

The infinity pool and the landscaping around the villa were so pretty and calming.

Green Tea Villa was really wonderful and we would stay there again, but something to note is that the electricity turns off when you leave the room, so when we were there during August it took the room a bit of time to cool down when we came back and turned the AC on.

I have read many travel blogs and learned that Sapa in Vietnam is truly majestic and romantic.
It seems there are many areas to visit, but the one that attracted me the most is Ta Van.
A blogger friend named Mike-1 introduced me to several accommodations like Ta Van Heaven Homestay, Little Ta Van Homestay, and even Sapa Eco.
I chose Sapa Eco because of its stunning views of the rice fields and mountains.

We stayed 4 nights at this location as a family with 2 young kids.
The hotel location is near a small village outside the crowded Sapa city.
From here it is easy to reach 2 beautiful hiking routes (Sapa bamboo trail + King Kong house loop).
The family room is spacious and has a terrace overlooking the rice fields.

(1) Although the staff kept being very friendly it felt like the restaurant is not managed professionally.

We experienced mistakes in receiving orders (burger instead of pizza), wrong meals prepared in kitchen (pasta carbonara instead of pasta bolognese), missing key ingredients in meals (no bacon wrt hamburger with bacon, no cashew nuts wrt stir fried chicken with cashew nuts), key ingredients not visible in meal (only chicken taste in fried rice with chicken), bad cooked meals (too much salt used in curry so that it really became un-eatable), long time before orders get delivered (in random order wrt different tables, finishing a table is not prioritized, often person at same table finished meal before last meal is delivered), often products are not available for multiple days (pizza, cashew nuts).
Summing this makes me think again why we kept eating here but there were no alternative restaurants available on this side of the river + we liked the presence of other hotel guests.
(2) On our last day we rented 2 scooters for 1 day via the hotel.
When we received the scooters the fuel tank was nearly empty and scooters were in a bad shape (speedometer and fuel meter not working, scooters looked worn out).
We are traveling for 2 months in Vietnam/Cambodia/Laos and we know for this day rate you can get much better.
When we were in Sapa city we were not able to start one of the scooters anymore likely due to battery issues.
Luckily way back to hotel was mainly downhill but costed us a lot of effort and time and we were not able to finish what was planned.
After complaining we got in the end 1 scooter fully discounted but of course we preferred reliable scooters instead.
Understood another guest experienced starting issues as well with different scooter.
(3) The family room near the swimming pool has no curtains at 2 windows at the pool side + entrance door (only glass decoration).
